title: Gingerbread Coffee Cake
directions: In large bowl, beat together butter, brown sugar, eggs, sour cream, and molasses. Set aside.
In medium bowl, stir together flours, ground ginger, candied ginger, baking powder, baking soda, and sea salt.
Add dry mixture to wet, stirring well until incorporated. Set aside.
Mix together topping ingredients. Set aside.
Line 9 x 9-inch metal pan with baking paper. Pour half batter into pan and smooth into corners. Sprinkle half of topping evenly over batter. Spread remaining batter and top with remaining topping.
Place coffeecake in oven and bake for 35-40 minutes until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Serve coffeecake warm as is or with softened, salted butter.
